item.title: About
item.description: I am a software engineer and problem solver from Sydney, Australia. As an undergrad, I studied at the University of New South Wales, in a Bachelor of Computer Engineering (Hons). I have been on the Dean’s Honour’s list, and maintained an HD-average. I was recently awarded the ‘Brightest Minds’ full scholarship for postgraduate studies at UNSW. My academic work covered many topics in computer science, focussing on both software and hardware design.

item.title: Projects
item.description: CellSim: Full-stack development of a web-hosted editing and visualization tool for CellML models. Client-server architecture (backend in C++using Mongoose, frontend with VueJS). Repository. Custom Rust Interpreter: As part of my univerisity studies, I build an interpreter for the Logo language in Rust. Repository. Zipf’s Law: A project to validate the rank-frequency distribution of the English language, given a large enough sample of text. This python program starts at the Wikipedia page for “Team sport” and follows the first link in each page, provided it has not been visited before.
